required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intraoperative NIRS of Transplanted Kidney for Prediction of Acute and Sub-acute Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Intraoperative Near Infrared Spectroscopy of Transplanted Kidney for Prediction of Acute and Sub-acute Kidney Injury in Transplanted Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, observational cohort study, designed to explore the use of NIRS in kidney transplants. This study will investigate an association between measurements of intra- operative NIRS and post - operative graft dysfunction as manifested in initiation of renal replacement therapy.

intervention.description: To measure the correlation between post arterial and venous anastomoses (reperfusion) NIRS values of transplanted kidney and post-transplant graft failure as manifested in initiation of renal replacement therapy post transplant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Kidney transplant candidates (living/ cadaver donor) at TLVMC who will consent to participate.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients unable to give consent,
- patients whose surgeries were aborted before transplant,
- patients who were lost to follow up during the first 7 post-transplant days,
- patients who suffered from surgical graft failure (vascular problems or need for re exploration due to bleeding etc.)
- No pregnant patients will participate in this study.
- No minors will participate in this study.
